    • Method Detail

      • getOpenTrustManager

        public static javax.net.ssl.TrustManager[] getOpenTrustManager()

      • disableSNI

        public static void disableSNI()
        Java 7 introduced SNI by default when you establish SSl connections. The problem is there is no way to turn it off or on at a per connection level. So if you are knowingly going to connect to a server that has a non SNI valid cert you have to disable SNI for the whole VM. The default is whatever the VM is started with you can disable it by running this method.

      • enableSNI

        public static void enableSNI()
        Java 7 introduced SNI by default when you establish SSl connections. The problem is there is no way to turn it off or on at a per connection level. So if you are knowingly going to connect to a server that has a non SNI valid cert you have to disable SNI for the whole VM. The default is whatever the VM is started with you can enable it by running this method.

      • generateKeyStoreFromPEM

        public static javax.net.ssl.KeyManagerFactory generateKeyStoreFromPEM(java.io.File certFile,
                                                                      java.io.File keyFile)
                                                               throws java.security.KeyStoreException
        Creates a KeyManagerFactory from PEM files (something java should just do...). There are some minor restrictions. The key must be in PKCS8 (not PKCS1).
        Parameters:
        certFile - the PEM encoded certificate file to use.
        keyFile - the PEM encoded key to use.
        Returns:
        a KeyManagerFactory using the provided cert and file.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyStoreException - Thrown if there is any kind of error opening or parsing the PEM files.
